name: Overall Winner
description: The LSE 2021 Python Coding Challenge focussed on financial services, utilising a cutting-edge virtual exchange developed by our employer sponsor, Optiver. Participants worked in interdisciplinary teams to develop trading algorithms in Python, testing and then optimising the algorithm's performance to achieve the best possible trading outcome. They then presented their processes and learning to a panel of judges from LSE Careers, LSE Digital Skills Lab, and employer-sponsor Optiver.

alignment.targetDescription: Institute of Coding, non academic, recognition for attaining a set of badges.

criteria.narrative:
Holders of this badge participated in the 2021 Python Coding Challenge by Optiver and were part of the team judged to have the highest performance in the competition and final submission to the judging panel. The judging panel consisted of LSE staff from the Careers Service and Digital Skills Lab, and Optiver's Lecturer and Head of Academic Partnerships.

The overall winning team gained the highest score across the four judging criteria for the competition - problem-solving approach, trading strategy, teamwork and presentation skills.
